meanings.definition: Unable to be touched or grasped; not having physical presence.
meanings.sent1: The concept of love is intangibles, as it cannot be held in your hand.
meanings.sent2: The artist's intangibles thoughts were reflected in her abstract paintings.
meanings.sent3: Trying to catch a cloud is like trying to hold onto intangibles.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter filled the room, a tangible sound in a world of intangibles.
meanings.sent5: The feeling of nostalgia is intangibles, yet it can be so powerful.

meanings.definition: Something that cannot be defined or measured precisely.
meanings.sent1: In business, reputation is one of the most valuable intangibles.
meanings.sent2: The importance of intangibles like trust and loyalty cannot be underestimated.
meanings.sent3: The mystery of the universe is full of intangibles waiting to be discovered.
meanings.sent4: Her dreams were like intangibles, slipping through her fingers when she woke up.
meanings.sent5: The beauty of a sunset is one of nature's most precious intangibles.
